BiblioData.Title: MAGNETIC IRON OXIDE PARTICLE, MAGNETIC MATERIAL, AND RADIO WAVE ABSORBER
BiblioData.Abstract: Disclosed is a magnetic material having high Hc and and High Curie point, which is capable of controlling such magnetic characteristics without requiring rare or expensive raw materials. Specifically disclosed is a magnetic material composed of particles of a magnetic iron oxide which is represented by the following general formula: [mu]-A x B y Fe 2-x-y O 3 or [mu]-A x B y C z Fe 2-x-y-z O 3 (wherein A, B and C each represents a metal excluding Fe and different from each other, satisfying 0 < x, y, z < 1), with [mu]-Fe 2 O 3 as a main phase.

Claims.P: 1. A magnetic iron oxide particle, with [epsilon]-Fe2O3 as a main phase, which is expressed by a general formula [epsilon]-AxByFe2-x-yO3(wherein A and B are mutually different metals excluding Fe, satisfying 0 < x, y < 1).

2. A magnetic iron oxide particle, with [epsilon]-Fe2O3 as a main phase, which is expressed by a general formula [epsilon]- AxByCzFe2-x-yO3 (wherein A and B are mutually different metals excluding Fe, satisfying 0 < x, y, z < 1).
3. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to the claim 1 or 2, wherein A is bivalent metal, B is quadrivalent metal, and C is trivalent metal.
4. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein A is one or more kinds of metals selected from Co, Ni, Mn, and Zn.
5. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein B is Ti.
6. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 2 to 5, wherein C is one or more kinds of metals selected from In, Ga, and Al.
7. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein a longest length of the magnetic iron oxide particle is 5nm or more and 120nm or less.
8. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 1 to 7, wherein a coercive force Hc is 39.8kA/m or more and 1194.3kA/m or less.
9. The magnetic iron oxide particle according to any one of claims 1 to 8, wherein saturation magnetization [sigma]s at 25[deg.]C is 0.1Am<2>/kg or more and 100Am<2>/kg or less.
10. A magnetic material containing the magnetic iron oxide particle of any one of claims 1 to 9, and a binder.
11. A radio wave absorber, with the magnetic iron oxide particle of any one of claims 1 to 9 dispersed in rubber or resin.
